measured_by: Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Self-Report (QIDS-SR)
justification: The paper states the primary outcome measure is the percent change in depression symptom severity on the QIDS-SR, indicating the scale is specifically used to assess depression symptom severity.

The WSAS is used as a secondary outcome measure to determine general impairment in psychosocial functioning due to mental health problems. It's included as an eligibility criteria and also captured weekly to track clinical changes.
The OCI-R was administered to assess OCD symptoms. This is described in the baseline assessment section, indicating its use in measuring OCD.
The trait portion of the STAI is specifically mentioned as measuring trait anxiety among other psychological constructs in the baseline assessment.
The AES is listed as one of the instruments used in the baseline assessment to measure apathy.
The EAT-26 is mentioned as a tool to measure eating disorders as part of the wide range of clinical data gathered in the baseline assessment.
The BIS-10 is directly referenced in the paper as being used to measure impulsivity during the baseline assessment.
The SSMS is used to measure schizotypy as part of the clinical data collection in the baseline assessment.
The LSAS is included to measure social anxiety as described in the instruments used for the baseline assessment.
The AUDIT is used during the baseline assessment to measure alcohol addiction.
The SDS is referenced in the paper as a baseline assessment measure for depression.
